result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Buker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 5 days (4-4-2015 to 04-08-2015). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Sentence maybe transferred to another other county if another county will accept.
Court notes that probation maybe transferred to another county if accepted.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at $0.00.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
No contact with any known illegal drug user.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
No contact with Matthew G. (DOB 11-09-1986).
Geographic are restriction within Milwaukee County, except for appointments required by DOC or agent.

Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
In the House of Correction or any other County that accepts transfer;  without good time credit; straight time. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol testing to serve 10 days.
*Second violation of positive drug or alcohol testing to serve 20 days.
*Third violation of positive drug or alcohol testing to serve 30 days.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Kathy B.

AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 5 days (4-4-2015 to 04-08-2015). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Sentence maybe transferred to another other county if another county will accept.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/ Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Matthew G. (DOB 11-09-1986).
- Geographic are restriction within Milwaukee County, except for appointments required by DOC or agent.
- Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction or any other County that accepts transfer;  without goodtime credit; straight time. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol testing to serve 10 days.
*Second violation of positive drug or alcohol testing to serve 20 days.
*Third violation of positive drug or alcohol testing to serve 30 days.
- Court notes that probation maybe transferred to another county if accepted.
- Fine is set at $0.00
- Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
For the reasons placed on the record, the Court DENIED the Defense request for expungement.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Matthew T Buker in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 15.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case spun to branch 17, Judge Stark. Files sent to court.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed. sab
